title: --Use the EDITOR to create and modify program source files and to store them on disk
Further details can be found in the ProDOS Assembler Tools User's Manual
--A defined, usable machine language interface
--Direct block access
--Enhanced BASIC command structure
--Easier Assembly Language program development and maintenance
--Up to 32 megabytes per volume, 16 megabytes per file
--Multiple logical volumes per physical volume
--Pseudo disk emulator using the Apple Extended Text Card, enabling fast file access and graphics screen switching
Immediately afterwards, save a second "dummy" 8K file to /RAM; this file will be saved at $4000 to $5FFF

Select the Catalyst Editor from the Catalyst menu
When the Catalyst Editor main menu comes up
From the list of Program manufacturers, select the entry for "Apple Computer, Inc."
Select the entry for "DOS 3.3 BASIC" from the list of Apple programs
